In childhood, when playing with friends, I liked to play the role of wife
In adolescence and youth I always had dreams of marriage and had great desire for married life, buying dowry and engagement ceremony and everything related to marriage
In adolescence and youth I was looking for a committed and serious relationship and only established connection with the opposite sex when I considered them suitable for marriage
I'm interested in a man I choose as husband to have status and I be proud of him
To me the wedding day is the most important and valuable day of life and I want to have a magnificent and elaborate wedding
My belief is: People become complete through marriage - a person who hasn't married is not complete
I expect my spouse to always pay attention to me, and when they don't take me seriously and aren't with me, my soul and spirit are hurt
I get very angry and react when my partner pays the slightest attention to anyone other than me, and I'm very jealous in this regard
If my spouse has a relationship with another woman, I definitely hold a grudge and take revenge on that woman who caused my married life to fall apart
I always have fear of betrayal within and fear that my partner will leave me and connect with someone else
My prominent characteristic is 'being a model wife' and everywhere I want to be beside my spouse and in line with our commitments
It makes me happy and proud if they call me by my husband's family name
Divorce is unacceptable to me and if my spouse wants to divorce me I absolutely don't accept it, even if my marriage is unsuccessful
Marital relationship is my first priority and if I want to have a profession it's in second priority and shouldn't harm my married life
My intention in having children is to strengthen my marital relationships
If my spouse upsets me, my motivation and energy for doing other things including paying attention to my children decreases
If conflict arises between spouse and children, obviously I generally take my spouse's side
I expect my children to behave in a way and reach positions that bring me credit and honor
I think if I lose my spouse for any reason, I feel I've lost the whole meaning of my life
I'm happy and fortunate when I have a successful marital relationship
My priority in matters is my spouse's satisfaction, and close people around, even myself, are in second priority

Even when I have a problem with my partner, I behave in a way that no one notices there's been a disagreement between us, and I'm not willing to separate my sleeping place from my spouse under any circumstances
I love gold and generally anything golden and am interested in luxury, glamour and a luxurious house
Most of my friends are spouses of my spouse's friends, and after marriage I prefer not to socialize with single and divorced friends of myself or my spouse
Obviously my spouse is responsible for fulfilling my needs
